abstract: Outside investigators conclude Cleveland policeman Tim Loehmann, who fatally shot 12-year-old Tamir Rice in 2014, acted reasonably; prosecutor's office claims report is not conclusive and continues to gather evidence for grand jury; Rice family and its lawyers express doubt about eventual prosecution.
lead_paragraph: The opinions, reached by a Colorado prosecutor and a former F.B.I. supervisory special agent, were released Saturday by a county prosecutor, who will present evidence to a grand jury.

headline.main: 2 Outside Reviews Say Cleveland Officer Acted Reasonably in Shooting Tamir Rice, 12
headline.print_headline: Reviews Say Cleveland Officer Who Shot Boy Acted Reasonably

snippet: The opinions, reached by a Colorado prosecutor and a former F.B.I. supervisory special agent, were released Saturday by a county prosecutor, who will present evidence to a grand jury.
